dedication.para: This book is dedicated to Elisha Gray. He submitted his patent for the telephone to the United States Patent Office on the morning of February 14th, 1876. Though Bell´s patent was submitted later, his cunning lawyer paid the patent fee in cash and obtained a receipt with an earlier processing time on it. Gray´s patent application languished in the in box and was processed officially hours later. Bell became a wealthy man, Gray a historical afterthought.
And of course, I dedicate this book to my partner, Guni, without whose interminable patience it would not have been possible.
